There has been a global phenomenon that more people have access to mobile phones. South Asia region is no exception on this where a large share of poor people have access to mobile phones than to electricity or improved water. For all countries in the region, cell phone users have significantyl grew.Even among those who don't have access to electricity still have access to cell phone which implies lower entry barriers to obtain them.  

Why do they have rapid increase in cell phone usage?

What does it imply?
Effective usage of technology may help reduce poverty in developing countries most of which have difficulties in investing in public infrastructure. Also, the low participation in development projects have casted the issue of accessibility of aid programs to local people. With hight percentage of cell phone users, we can compensate the shortcomings of aid program especially in eduation, health and agriculture sectors by efficiently sharing knowledge with people.
